content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Discover a suitable chocolate cupcake recipe on Allrecipes that has a preparation time of under 1 hour and at least 100 user reviews.  Please interact with https://www.allrecipes.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find a suitable chocolate cupcake recipe, I should start by searching for "chocolate cupcake" using the search bar. The textbox for entering the search query is labeled [2] and the search button is labeled [3].
Action: Type [2]; chocolate cupcake
Confidence: 1.0
Completion: 0.15
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search results for "chocolate cupcake" are now displayed, showing several options. To select a recipe that meets the task criteria, I need to access more recipe details such as preparation time and number of user reviews. I'll start by clicking on the first option to examine its information.
Action: Click [9]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Chocolate Cupcakes" recipe has 1,255 reviews (well over the requirement of 100), but I need to check if the preparation time is under 1 hour. The visible area does not show the prep time, so I should scroll down to look for this information.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The preparation time is still not visible. I should continue scrolling down to find the recipe details such as preparation time, which is usually listed near the ingredients or instructions.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I still do not see the preparation time information. The "Jump to Recipe" button [12] should lead directly to the full recipe details, including prep time. Clicking this will help efficiently locate the info needed.
Action: Click [12]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The Ingredients section has appeared, but the prep time is still not visible. The prep time is typically found at the top of the recipe instructions or in a summary section just above the ingredients. I should scroll down further to look for prep time or the method/timing breakdown.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Directions" section has started, but there is still no visible information about the overall preparation time. The prep time is usually outlined above or near the start of the directions. I should scroll further down to check for a summary table or step overview that mentions total prep or bake time.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot shows an instructional image and some advertisements, but there isn’t any new information revealed about the preparation time. To proceed, I need to continue scrolling to look for a summary or time breakdown.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.82
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current screenshot continues to show recipe steps and an instructional image, but there's still no visible overall preparation time listed. I should keep scrolling down to reach the section where they typically summarize the prep, cook, and total time for the recipe.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot again shows more instructional steps and media, but there is still no information regarding the total preparation or cooking time for the recipe. I need to continue scrolling to reach the summary or the end of the directions, where this information is typically listed.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.87
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The page is now showing "Step 5" of the recipe directions, which means we are likely near the end of the instructions. The prep or total time information is typically listed after the steps or at the very end of the recipe. Continuing to scroll is necessary to find this section.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.88
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot now shows "Step 6," which includes the baking time (15 to 17 minutes), indicating the recipe instructions are nearing completion. The prep or total time summary usually appears immediately after the final step or in a summary table at the end of the recipe. I should scroll down just a bit more to locate the overall time information.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.9
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: This screenshot reveals that 3,311 home cooks made the recipe, confirming far more than the minimum 100 user reviews. The section with summary information is likely below, possibly showing prep and total time. I should scroll down slightly more to find this final prep time information to fully confirm suitability.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.95
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot displays nutrition summary and a community Q&A section but does not show the total or preparation time for the recipe. The recipe definitely meets the review criteria, but since the total prep time still hasn't been explicitly shown and might be above (near method, nutrition facts, or summary area), I should scroll up a bit to check those preceding sections.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.93
Completion: 0.95
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot is nearly identical to a previous one, showing the number of home cooks (3,311) and options to save, print, or indicate making the recipe. There is still no information about preparation time visible. The recipe summary or time information is likely further up the page above the nutrition and community sections.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.93
Completion: 0.95
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot now shows the end of Step 6 with the baking time (15 to 17 minutes), but still no total prep time. To locate the overall preparation time or a summary that usually appears immediately above the directions, I should continue scrolling up a bit more.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.93
Completion: 0.96
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The screenshot now shows Step 5 of the directions, indicating we are getting closer to the top of the recipe directions—a location where prep time or a summary is often presented. To find the displayed preparation time or summary, I should scroll up a bit more.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.93
Completion: 0.97

content.text:
Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: <button> "Main menu for Allrecipes";	[1]: "Allrecipes", "Visit Allrecipes' homepage";	[2]: <button> "Save", "Save Recipe";	[3]: <button> "Rate", "Rate It";	[4]: "Log In";	[6]: "Join for free: Use MyRecipes to save 100K+ recipes from Allrecipes and more";	[7]: <button> "Close";

content:
Thought: This screenshot now displays the end of one of the previous steps in the directions, indicating we're slightly above Step 5, but still within the steps detail area. The overall prep time or summary is likely still a bit further up. To efficiently locate the total or prep time, I should continue scrolling up.
Action: Scroll [WINDOW]; up
Confidence: 0.93
Completion: 0.97
